arguments.argument: A wealth tax helps reduce income inequality.
Billionaires can afford to contribute more to society.
It raises revenue for public programs and services.
The ultra-wealthy often pay lower effective tax rates.
Wealth taxes promote economic fairness.
It can curb dynastic wealth accumulation.
Other countries have successfully implemented wealth taxes.
It ensures everyone pays their fair share.
Capital gains and assets often go untaxed for the wealthy.
It’s necessary to fund investments in education, healthcare, and infrastructure.
Wealth taxes may discourage investment and entrepreneurship.
Enforcing a wealth tax is difficult and expensive.
It may lead to capital flight or tax evasion.
The wealthy already pay substantial income and property taxes.
Asset values can fluctuate, making wealth hard to measure.
It could hurt the economy and job creation.
Wealth taxes have failed or been repealed in several countries.
It could lead to double taxation on the same assets.
High taxes on the wealthy may disincentivize philanthropy.
The focus should be on closing loopholes, not new taxes.
